p: Small rodents, birds, medium-sized mammals, and non-human primates (NHPs) have been used in MBF research (Kimura et al., 2010; Goodfellow et al., 2016; Maximova et al., 2016). NHPs have traditionally been used to study human viruses because much of the host-specific pathophysiology is conserved between primates and humans. Protective efficacy of novel vaccines for MBFs has been demonstrated in primates for DENV (Guirakhoo et al., 2004), WNV (Petersen et al., 2013), and ZIKV (Abbink et al., 2016), but their efficacy in humans still needs to be corroborated (Torresi et al., 2017; Vannice et al., 2019). Primates also present maintenance challenges due to high cost and the strict requirements of high-containment biosafety facilities.
